waterActions.title: Turn off
waterActions.text: Turn off the water while you are brushing your teeth
waterActions.text_3rdPerson: Turn off the tapwhile brushing your teeth
waterActions.text_1stPerson: I turned off the tap while brushing my teeth
waterActions.fact: Turning off the water when you brush your teeth can save a gallon of fresh water a minute!

waterActions.title: Showering
waterActions.text: Cut your shower time by 20% or take one fewer showers per week.
waterActions.text_1stPerson: I took a shorter shower (3-5 mins)
waterActions.fact: An average shower uses about 5 gallons of water per minute. If you shorten your shower by 2 minutes, you can cut your water use by 10 gallons. You can further reduce your water consumption by turning the water off

waterActions.title: Washing
waterActions.text_1stPerson: I washed full loads of laundry
waterActions.fact: One of the largest uses of water in American households is laundry.Nearly 22 % of household water usage is consumed just to do the laundry.A typical household can save 3, 400 gallons of water a year by running full laundry loads instead of half loads, according to the U.S.Department of Energy

waterActions.title: Running Water
waterActions.text: let the water run when washing your pots and pans
waterActions.text_3rdPerson: Wash dishes by hand without running the water
waterActions.text_1stPerson: I washed dishes by hand without wasting water
waterActions.fact: If you wash and rinse without running the water while you are cleaning your dishes, this the second most efficient method for cleaning dishes.

waterActions.title: Dish Washing
waterActions.text: Wash your dishes in a dish washer
waterActions.fact: You use up to 27 gallons of water per load by hand versus as little as 3 gallons with an ENERGY STAR - rated dishwasher.And just scrape off the food scraps instead of rinsing each dish before you load it.

waterActions.title: Watering
waterActions.text: Water your garden / lawn early or late
waterActions.text_3rdPerson: Water your garden / lawn early or late
waterActions.text_1stPerson: I watered my garden early or late
waterActions.fact: A green lawn is a suburban ideal that drinks more than 20, 000 gallons of water each year.

waterActions.title: Water Heads
waterActions.text: Replace showers and taps with low flow heads
waterActions.text_3rdPerson: Replace your shower and sink heads
waterActions.text_1stPerson: I replaced my shower and sink heads
waterActions.fact: you can achieve water savings of 25 % â€“60 % .Learn more about low - flow showerheads and faucets.

waterActions.title: Turn Off taps
waterActions.text: Turn off water while washing hands
waterActions.text_1stPerson: I turned off the water while washing my hands
waterActions.fact: The average American washes his or her hands nearly 9 times per day. If you follow guidelines to scrub your hands with soap for at least 20 seconds, you could save at least 6 gallons per day by turning off the tap while you scrub.
